Posts.EditableText: So my last laptop broke. It's where I kept the files for my game. Is there a way to get them back? For ur info there is a published version of it so can I get the files from that?
Posts.HTML: So my last laptop broke. It's where I kept the files for my game. Is there a way to get them back? For ur info there is a published version of it so can I get the files from that?

Posts.EditableText: You could take the hard disk, mount it to your computer via a USB adaptor or something and copy/paste, if possible.
Posts.HTML: You could take the hard disk, mount it to your computer via a USB adaptor or something and copy/paste, if possible.

Posts.EditableText: I don't  really have the old computer anymore, unfortunatelly :(
Posts.HTML: I don't really have the old computer anymore, unfortunatelly :(

Posts.EditableText:
I somehow did it.Found a similar problem and decided to try it out (http://textadventures.co.uk/forum/quest/topic/jvqi6mtbqkigtilf1zll3w/recovering-source-code-of-my-old-game  )

 I downloaded my own game, unzipped it. It gave me a file called game that seemed to work except that I couldn't view any of mywriting. Only the rooms and objects. After I put the 2 include texts (EditorEnglish and CoreEditor) It got to working!
<include ref="EditorEnglish.aslx"/>
  <include ref="CoreEditor.aslx"/>
And then It got all fixed up.
Posts.HTML:
I somehow did it.Found a similar problem and decided to try it out (http://textadventures.co.uk/forum/quest/topic/jvqi6mtbqkigtilf1zll3w/recovering-source-code-of-my-old-game )

I downloaded my own game, unzipped it. It gave me a file called game that seemed to work except that I couldn't view any of mywriting. Only the rooms and objects. After I put the 2 include texts (EditorEnglish and CoreEditor) It got to working!
